result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:50 AM Defendant Crishawn R Clemons in court, in custody.  Attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: from SPD, defendant is eligible for services.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:37 PM Defendant Crishawn R Clemons appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Crishawn R Clemons.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Return on warrant/Initial appearance on October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
Warrant is being forwarded to RCSO/Dispatch for entry
